docs.text: many people dislike french films for their lack of closure .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: while possibly shallow , i've often had a desire for a sense of epiphany , or at least a resolution , in the films which i view .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: there is no revelation in un coeur en hiver in the traditional ; however , the film is incredibly successful in its passionate dramatization of a passion-denying protagonist , stephane ( daniel auteuil ) .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: stephane ( daniel auteuil ) is a master violin maker .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: he is passionless about all that which surrounds him except his craft and the music which his craft is responsible for producing .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: even the relationship between he and his boss , maxime ( andre dussollier ) is a controlled , and almost manipulated association , highlighted by the fact that stephane permits maxime to win close squash matches .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: in the beginning of the movie , stephane is a closed , solitary individual and the audience is carefully left to wonder about the depth of emotion behind this enigmatic man .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: camille kessler ( emmanuelle beart ) is a master violinist and the new love of maximes .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: maxime is so much in love with camille that he plans to and does leave his wife .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: like stephane , camille is outwardly very controlled and reserved , sacrificing all thought and emotion to her violin and the music which emerges .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: when stephane and camille meet , there is a recognition of a bonding by both individuals .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: however , whereas camille submits to the wild interplay of emotions which she now feels for stephane , stephane only admits that camille is attracted to him .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: stephane ignores his feelings for camille , which the audience cannot help but to see is present .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: as the movie progresses , the two characters become more and more polarized in their views and emotions for one another .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: these two people , with very similar approaches to life initially , react to their new circumstance very differently .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: stephane becomes even more rational and controlled , while camille becomes more tempestuous , until she almost borders on suffering a nervous breakdown due to the inability to consummate their relationship .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: however , their approach to each other is perhaps not surprising considering their vocation .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the audience is led to believe that stephane may have been a genius as a violinist as well , due to his relationship with a master violin teacher .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: however , apparently , he could not be a violinist due to his intolerance for flaws in his playing .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: consequently , stephane becomes a precision craftsmen with the instrument and no longer plays .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: in contrast , camille had almost given the violin , years earlier .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: however , with the aid of her manager , she has progressed to being almost one of the world's finest , successfully submerging herself to her playing .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: during the course of the movie , we see both characters evolve as they struggle to meet the challenge of their new emotions .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: stephane attempts to remain unchanged .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: however , we do see subtle hints of his transformation .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: one of the most obvious is when he defeats maxime in squash .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the development of all of the characters , many of which is not included in this synopsis , is incredible .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: american movies , with rare exceptions , have not and i would daresay cannot approach foreign films in character development .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: in its essence , this movie is about the development and growth of the characters , camille and stephane .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the portrayal of all the other characters in the movie , including a death , is to further the development of camille's and stepahne's characters .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: i am not sure why berardinelli says , " at times it becomes difficult to determine whether stephane should be pitied or vilified , and it is to auteuil's credit that he manages to maintain this uncertainty . "
docs.label: positive

docs.text: this movie is not about judging stephane's actions as being right or wrong , but about viewing their growth and accepting the characters as who they are .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: i find the ending appropriate ; unfortunately , i found the last ten minutes which led up to the final scene to be very unfulfilling .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: this portion of the film is where the " sense of closure " could have been successfully accomplished .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: unfortunately , there is a hurried and almost a soap opera-type surge of emotions from all of the characters .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: while ravel may not be quite as accomplished as schubert or mozart , ravel has his day in this film .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the synergism of the tension of ravel's music and tension on the screen is the best i have ever seen .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the directing in this movie is wonderful .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the actors and actresses are excellent , each playing their part with great sincerity and warmth .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: emmanuelle beart's personality is beautiful .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: and needless to say , i must say that emmanuelle beart , herself , is beautiful .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: besides the near ending , the only other criticism of the movie which i have is that the movie is almost too cerebral .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: i almost left with the sense little happened because almost all the changes which occur in the movie happen in deep in their psyches and little in their personalities or the situations which they end as part of .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the one question which i am left with is while they have accepted their lot , has their attitude towards love changed ?
docs.label: positive

docs.text: i have several possibilities which i believe the movie hints at , but i am unsure of which the director is espousing .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: in summary , this movie is solely about the character growth of two characters who almost develop a relationship .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: in the process , we see their attitude towards life and other people .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: in itself , i do not believe un coeur is a complicated movie .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: where it does become complicated is when we juxtapose the scenes of the movie into the greater walk of life where we , as americans , have preconceived american notions of relationship , love , and people .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: i do wonder how the movie translates when viewed within its native french culture .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: however , i , bringing my american preconceptions , enjoyed the film .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: i would welcome any comments about this movie from any who have seen it .
docs.label: positive
